summary: The No Biometric Barriers to Housing Act of 2025 prohibits the use of facial, physical, and remote biometric recognition technologies in covered federally assisted rental dwelling units. It defines these technologies and specifies the types of housing programs affected. The bill mandates a report from the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to Congress, detailing the current usage of these technologies, their effects on tenants, resident demographics, and potential impacts on vulnerable communities regarding privacy, civil rights, and fair housing.
